text: To find delicious eggs, I am now at a place where I can find fresh eggs.
I would like to eat the ultimate egg on rice here!
At Tama Egg Sodegaura Farm, you can get freshly-laid eggs, and chicken are free-ranging.
Usually, you hold a bucket in one hand and pick eggs.
But this time, we were given a chance to interact with the chickens.
Let's go to the chicken coop!
I put on a browband and...fight! Go!
But before that, let's talk to Mr. Mori of this egg farm.
You have two kinds of chicken here:
Boris Brown was really interested in the filming crew!
I shall go egg picking!
Araucana is shy, as I expected...
Will you lay eggs for me?
Sorry to interrupt your work...
[As a chicken] It's all right; go to the other side!
Thank you, chicken!
The ultimate egg on rice!
Can I make something else?
Hi, I'm Francis, the host of this show, "Cooking with Dog"!
First, freeze the eggs.
When you freeze the eggs, they expand, and the eggshells crack.
So, put them inside plastic bags to prevent the egg white from leaking.
Leave them in the freezer for a night.
Then, wait...
...and wait...
Chef is calling me!
Take them out of the freezer, and wait a few hours until they naturally defrost.
The yolk is thick, soft, and sticky and can be picked up using chopsticks.
To allow the flavor to set in, cover it with plastic wrap
and place it in the fridge for around one hour,
and you end up with a pretty tasty marinated egg!
It lasts about three weeks, if it is kept inside the freezer.
Did I do a good job letting you know about Japanese eggs?
When you come to Japan, please try raw eggs, all right?
I must go now.  Chef is waiting for me!
